snippet: Teams increasingly want their radio analysts fluent in the language of WAR — that’s wins above replacement — and other advanced statistics, known as sabermetrics.
abstract: Radio broadcasts of baseball games, one-sided conversations that create a cozy intimacy between fans and announcers, are colliding with cold calculations known as sabermetrics; as statistical analysis becomes part of the fabric of the game and an object of growing fascination to fans, teams increasingly want their radio announcers fluent in advanced statistics, known as sabermetrics, rather than homespun lore.

byline.contributor: David Waldstein and Andrew Keh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Teams increasingly want their radio analysts fluent in the language of WAR — that’s wins above replacement — and other advanced statistics, known as sabermetrics.

headline.seo: Baseball Broadcasts Introduce Advanced Statistics, but With Caution
headline.main: Era of Modern Baseball Stats Brings WAR to Booth
